intro: Premna angustior, commonly known as narrowleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in the early morning, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Premna angustior is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
